channel.title: New distro :)
channel.description:
I'm using Cent OS, and I wanna change. I've thought of Fedora, and It's nice.
I'm using GNOME At the moment, do you think I should use KDE?

item.title: New distro :)
item.dc:creator: @communist communist
item.description:
@communist wrote:

sppt:

Wait, what, 200 gb of steamapps? That’s a lot man, what’d you do to it o.O

I have a well paid job ;). When I tried to install Steam, I installed it over where it already was, loosing ALL of my saves and games. I’m really pissed!

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:14, topic:279773”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=369170.msg2794843#msg2794843 date=1243011316]
Moparisthebest,
Can you explain the main differences between Debian with KDE and kubuntu?
[/quote]

I have used/use both, a slight difference is kubuntu tends to have more up to date packages than debian testing, and debian unstable isn’t quite as stable as kubuntu. The main difference is that debian doesn’t supply or support anything that is not open source, and while that is good on a policy level, it makes it a lot harder to get your broadcom wifi card to work at all, or your nvidia video card to work adequately. They are both great distros and it is hard to decide which one to go for.[/quote]
QFT. KDE is the BEST.

Read full topic

item.title: New distro :)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:3, topic:279773”]Moparisthebest,
Can you explain the main differences between Debian with KDE and kubuntu?[/quote]

I have used/use both, a slight difference is kubuntu tends to have more up to date packages than debian testing, and debian unstable isn’t quite as stable as kubuntu. The main difference is that debian doesn’t supply or support anything that is not open source, and while that is good on a policy level, it makes it a lot harder to get your broadcom wifi card to work at all, or your nvidia video card to work adequately. They are both great distros and it is hard to decide which one to go for.

Read full topic

item.title: New distro :)
item.dc:creator: @communist communist
item.description:
@communist wrote:

Steam won’t let me change the install directory though… I have my drive with the games on mounted as a D drive.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 24, 2009, 07:21:46 am[/size][hr]Sweet. Got Stem working on my other hard drive :).

It deleted my ~200gb steam apps though D:.

Time to copy them over for another computer :).

item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“communist, post:6, topic:279773”]I’ve used wine before, and hopefully I’ll get this working tomorrow. I’m not on a high-end machine now (Waiting for my quad core, 8gb ram (for teh LOLS) to be ordered), but it can play games well.

Fedora 10 cd (32 bit, i think) KDE.

Installing tomorrow.[/quote]
You’re going to want x64 on that machine.

item.title: New distro :)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

CentOS is based on Red Hat; so is Fedora. Fedora is more of a workstation-aimed distro, so I think you’ll be happy. When installing, use Fedora 10 x64 DVD and select to update the software before the initial install. Also, choose KDE.

Edit: I just saw your Steam question. It is possible and works pretty well if you know what you’re doing.

Read full topic

item.title: New distro :)
item.dc:creator: @communist communist
item.description:
@communist wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Use KDE 3.5, it is the best I’ve used so far. I recommend kubuntu for a distro.

Okay.

And I’m not a noob, just oo lazy to configure an Arch. Rather just download it all at once.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 22, 2009, 10:57:08 am[/size][hr][quote=“Fat Cookies, post:3, topic:279773”][quote author=communist link=topic=369170.msg2794827#msg2794827 date=1243010616]
I’m using GNOME At the moment, do you think I should use KDE?
[/quote]
HELL YES. GNOME is the biggest pice of shit ever. KDE is much better in every single aspect.
Whats wrong with Cent OS anyway?
I would recommend Arch just like a lot of people here. Its full of really nice scripts and a good wiki.

Moparisthebest,
Can you explain the main differences between Debian with KDE and kubuntu?[/quote]

I just want a change. Cent OS is getting boring now…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 22, 2009, 11:01:07 am[/size][hr]Another: I would rep both of you, but I need 15 to rep someone else. Damn[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 22, 2009, 11:09:14 am[/size][hr]Downloading Fedora 10 KDE now.

Another question:
At the moment I’m using a really stripped version of winblows with just steam on it so I can play games.

Is there any way I can play STEAM games on linux with Wine or something?

Read full topic
